name: Siemens AG
goal: Siemens AG (HQ in Berlin and Munich, founded in 1847) is one of the world's largest companies in electrical engineering and electronics. Siemens AG operates in the fields of electrification, automation and digitalization. The EU Government Affairs Liaison Office represents Siemens AG towards the EU institutions and related stakeholders.
interests: Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
10 most important topics / initiatives:
Energy Policy (e.g. Clean Energy Package)
Climate Policy (e.g. EU Emissions Trading System)
Connected & Automated Mobility
Free Trade Agreements
EU Framework Programme for Research and Innovation Horizon 2020, and the planned FP9 / New MFF
EU Cybersecurity Act
Data Economy Package / Digital Single Market
Health Technology Assessments (HTA)
Cohesion Policy
Circular Economy
